decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to ramp up your mana quickly with various mana dorks and land ramp spells, allowing you to cast powerful threats like Titania, Protector of Argoth and Craterhoof Behemoth ahead of schedule. Utilizing cards like Life from the Loam and Crucible of Worlds to repeatedly return lands from your graveyard, you can create an overwhelming board presence and outvalue your opponent. The deck also includes utility creatures and spells like Eternal Witness and Beast Within to deal with threats, as well as cards like Scapeshift and Titania's ability to create elemental tokens when lands enter the battlefield. Ultimately, the goal is to swarm the board with creatures and overwhelm your opponent with aggressive plays.

The main goal of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful spells and creatures. By utilizing strong counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage to the opponent. Cards like Splinter Twin and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker provide combo potential for explosive turns, while planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Chandra, Torch of Defiance offer additional card advantage and board control. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and access to all necessary colors. Overall, the deck focuses on applying early pressure and maintaining tempo to secure victory in a 1 vs 1 duel.

The deck revolves around utilizing Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and protection spells. The goal is to protect Geist of Saint Traft and disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage through card draw and manipulation. The deck includes a variety of control tools such as counterspells like Counterspell and Mana Leak, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Detention Sphere, and protection spells like Mother of Runes and Steel of the Godhead. The deck also includes equipment to enhance Geist of Saint Traft's abilities and win the game through combat damage. Overall, the key strategy is to outlast the opponent and control the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. With Zurgo Bellstriker as the commander, the deck includes a wide range of low-cost, high-impact spells and creatures to push for early board presence and pressure. The deck includes a variety of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Incinerate, and Magma Jet to both control the opponent's board and deal direct damage. Additionally, the deck features a mix of hasty creatures like Goblin Guide and Flamewake Phoenix to apply consistent pressure. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays and efficient removal spells to secure a victory in a swift manner.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, bounce effects, and manipulation of the opponent's library. Vendilion Clique is used as the commander to disrupt the opponent's strategy and provide additional card advantage. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw effects to maintain control of the battlefield. It also features powerful win conditions such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Sword of War and Peace to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been exhausted. The mana base includes utility lands like Wasteland and Academy Ruins to further enhance the deck's control capabilities.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing burn spells and creature aggression to quickly reduce their life total to zero. The key strategy is to constantly apply pressure, using efficient spells and creatures to keep the opponent on the back foot and prevent them from stabilizing. By maintaining a relentless assault and maximizing damage output each turn, the deck aims to secure victory before the opponent has a chance to recover. With a strong focus on direct damage and tempo plays, this deck aims to finish the game quickly and decisively, punishing any slow or durdling strategies with its efficient and powerful aggression.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and bounce effects, allowing Geist of Saint Traft to attack and deal consistent damage. The deck also includes cards like Spell Queller and Vendilion Clique to disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like True-Name Nemesis and Sword of War and Peace provide additional threats and protection. The deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot by countering key spells, removing threats, and deploying disruptive creatures, all while chipping away at the opponent's life total with Geist of Saint Traft. The deck's versatility and ability to adapt to different situations make it a strong contender in a 1 vs 1 format like Duel Commander.

This deck focuses on an aggressive playstyle, utilizing powerful creatures alongside removal and combat tricks to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Bruse Tarl, Boorish Herder provides valuable lifelink and double strike abilities, allowing for efficient combat and life gain. The deck includes various removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats, while also running creatures with strong enter the battlefield effects and abilities like haste and trample. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and includes utility lands like Dryad Arbor and Cavern of Souls. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain tempo throughout the game to secure a swift victory.
